name: Kobold Dynamics
description: A mech part manufacturer specialising in light parts. Based in the system of Yalaris, they recieve advanced lightweight metals like Andalum from the Fulcrum system.

name: Harrison Armory
description: A renowned industrial giant turned militarist dictatorship known for heavy-duty mech frames and advanced weaponry.

name: Jetson Laboritories
description: A think-tank and research facility, producing advanced mechs and weapons. A focus on elemental research and development.

name: Polaris Corporation
description: Privately-owned pace exploration and elite haulage firm, based on Fortuna, they are radical growthmongers and frequently compensate lancers for travelling to remote systems for exploration.

name: Union
description: Humanity wrestled for millions of years under the same burden of the common terrestrial animal. Circa 12,000 BC, they began to selectively grow plants for produce. Successive ages of civilisations led to metalwork, which culminated in the development of machines. In 1961 AD, the first man left Terra. By 2145 AD, mankind had permanent colonies on the moon. By 2350 AD, mankind had left their home star system, Sol. Ages of war, strife and collapse led Terra and Ares to their demise. Mankind persevered, and emerged from Enclave bunkers and used preserved technologies in the vaults of Terra. They founded Union on 0 U. Union is a communist beaurocracy manufacturing generalist but not particularly advanced mechs. It's core mechs, the Fuji, Matterhorn and Everest are some of the most widely used mechs in Human Space.

name: Striker
description: Striker mechs are balanced for direct combat, excelling in both offense and defense. They are versatile and reliable in most combat situations.

name: Artillery
description: Artillery mechs specialize in long-range attacks and area control, providing heavy fire support from a distance.

name: Utility
description: Utility mechs focus on support, electronic warfare, and battlefield control, offering unique abilities to aid allies and disrupt enemies.

name: Light
description: Light mechs are fast and agile, excelling at hit-and-run tactics and reconnaissance. They have limited armor and firepower but are difficult to pin down.

name: Medium
description: Medium mechs offer a balance between speed, armor, and firepower. They are versatile and adaptable to a wide range of combat roles.

name: Heavy
description: Heavy mechs are slow but heavily armored and armed. They excel at frontline combat and can absorb significant damage while delivering powerful attacks.

name: Super Heavy
description: Super Heavy mechs are rare, massive war machines with unmatched durability and firepower, but are extremely slow and costly to deploy.

name: Core Worlds
description: The core worlds, population centers with significant history of human habitation, located in Union Space. It includes the systems of Sol, Centa, Proxima, Barnard, Procyon and Luyten.

name: Inner Rim
description: The region of space firmly controlled by Union, just outside the Core Worlds. Sometimes called the Colonies. It includes the systems of Acrux, Umara, Altair, Yalaris, Wulften, Vega, Altum, Novas and Calliope.

name: Outer Rim
description: Those colonies further out from the Core Worlds, which are still accessible via Hypergates. The Outer Rim links Union Space to Karrakin Space. It includes the systems of Karth, Grinfeldt, Reach, Arcadia and Ivitan.

name: Trade Spine
description: The Goldin Trade Spine, located in the Galactic Northeast of the Outer Rim, is a highly travelled Hypergate route frequented by merchants due to the present natural resources and trade infrastructure of the region. It includes the systems of Pollux, Partisan, Goldin, Corune, Olcraff and Fulcrum.

name: The Frontier
description: A vast expanse of nearly or entirely uninhabited worlds. Connects the Wulften System to the Andaluse System via the Hensik Route of Hypergates. It is usually considered to include the systems of Sirius, Ventra, Calypso, Trigan, Eduu, Varlush, Zagreb, Thundt and sometimes Andaluse.

name: Karrakin Space
description: The ancient region of space gradually colonised by the Karrakins. Contains the systems of Karrakis, Foralis, Mantra, Apollo, Miru, Trappist.

name: Harrison Space
description: The region of outer space ruled by Harrison Armories. Contains the systems of Helgar and Caerus.

name: Terra
description: Terra, also known as Earth or Cradle, is the homeworld of the human race. It is the most populous world in the Sol system, with a population of 7 billion. It is the symbolic capital of Union, and is one of the two most prestigious worlds in mapped space, the other being Karrakis. Earth is heavily controlled to ensure its state of nature is preserved, and almost never licences new construction projects. Ships are not permitted to land on Terra, and must first dock at a spaceport. Many ruins of past human civilisations can be found overgrown in the wilderness of the planet.

name: Ares
description: Mars, officially known as Ares, is the second most populous world in the Sol system. It is the homeworld of the Martian people, also colloquially called Cydonians. A forge world, Mars' urban centers are largely underground surrounding foundries which construct most of the mechs used in the Sol system.

name: Eden
description: Eden, in the Andaluse System, is a world full of lush rainforests and rolling hills. It's verdant paradise is punctuated by shining rivers of liquid erezene.

name: Barnard
description: A thriving mercantile world, Barnard Prime is a hub of trade and commerce. It is the capital of the Barnard system, and is home to the Barnard Prime fleet. It is a major port city, and is home to the Barnard Prime Auxiliary.

name: Proxima
description: A highly populated ecumenopolis, Proxima is a center for commerce, finance and industry constructed in its modern form in 130 U. It is home to the Cosimo Opticon, a massive orbital factory and research facility. Its far side, Yimtess, is known as a music hot-spot. It is noted for having a diverse and culture-rich population, which numbers in the billions.

name: Reach
description: A world of vast deserts and towering mountains, Reach is a world of great beauty and mystery set between Union and Karrakin Space.

name: Grinfeldt
description: A military planet orbiting a dying binary system, Grinfedlt is mostly a desolute nuclear wasteland, with almost no permanent population. Named originally for an early Union explorer, it is now known as a graveyard of mechs, with many scavengers visiting to loot valuable parts.

name: Haven
description: A garden world, being the galactic center for life sciences research. It is home to the Haven Institute, a major scientific forum and political caucus. It has a population cap of 1 billion, which must reside in designated arcologies.

name: Toliman
description: Toliman is a city planet and metro world orbiting Alpha Centauri. It enjoys political power within Union as a relatively ancient ally of the government.

name: Vargoss
description: A desert planet, a sea of vast gray-orange dunes.

name: Karrakis
description: The jewel of the Karrakin Empire, believed by many to be the true spiritual home of humanity. Survivors of the Collapse, the Karrakin's ancestors were highly hierarchical and militaristic. Home of the House of Order, which resides in the Great Diamond Palace of Karrakis: an incomprehensibly large and decadant temple to the Emperor's ancestors.

name: Garont
description: The jewel of the Karrakin Empire, believed by many to be the true spiritual home of humanity. Survivors of the Collapse, the Karrakin's ancestors were highly hierarchical and militaristic. Home of the House of Order, which resides in the Great Diamond Palace of Karrakis: an incomprehensibly large and decadant temple to the Emperor's ancestors.
